page.title: 02ST VINCENT'S HOSPITAL
page.content: This is a hospital that specialises in orthopaedic problems.It is situated on the top of Haste Hill,which is 300 feet above sea level.It has an orchard.The open air wards face south and provide a magnificent view for patients. Many school charities donate money to the hospital to provide it with expensive equipment.The hospital is run mainly by Catholic nuns. The hospital's object is summed up as; the prevention of crippling diseases, the openair treatment of crippled children and adults, the after care treatment and supervision of patients discharged from hospital, the training and rehabilitation of the crippled, and the provision of a training school for orthopaedic nurses. It was built in Clapham in 1907 and moved to Haste Hill in May 1912.
